action.action-desc: Mrs. Love (for herself and Mr. Huizenga) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 to provide relief from the Volcker Rule for community banks.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Volcker Rule Relief Act of 2018.
Section 13(h)(1) of the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 (12 U.S.C. 1851(h)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (D), by redesignating clauses (i) and (ii) as subclauses (I) and (II), respectively, and adjusting the margins accordingly;
by redesignating subparagraphs (A) through (D) as clauses (i) through (iv), respectively, and adjusting the margins accordingly;
in the matter preceding clause (i), as so redesignated, in the second sentence, by striking institution that functions solely in a trust or fiduciary capacity, if— and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: that functions solely in a trust or fiduciary capacity, if—

paragraph.text: in clause (iv)(II), as so redesignated, by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: that does not have, and is not controlled by a covered fund or a bank holding company that has—

clause.text: more than $10,000,000,000 in total consolidated assets; and
total trading assets and trading liabilities, as reported on the most recent applicable regulatory filing filed by the institution, that are more than 5 percent of total consolidated assets.
